sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition:

4x + 2y - 6z = 10 

2x + 8y + 2z = 12 

-6x + 2y - 12z = -14
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition, we first need to rewrite the system in matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

A = |  4   2  -6 |
    |  2   8   2 |
    | -6   2 -12 |

b = | 10 |
    | 12 |
    |-14 |

Now, we perform QR decomposition on matrix A, which means we factor A into the product of an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the QR decomposition of A:

1. Calculate the orthonormal basis for the column space of A:

u1 = (4, 2, -6)
e1 = u1 / ||u1|| = (4, 2, -6) / sqrt(4^2 + 2^2 + (-6)^2) = (2/3, 1/3, -1)

u2 = (2, 8, 2) - proj(u1, (2, 8, 2))
u2 = (2, 8, 2) - (2/3, 1/3, -1) * ((4, 2, -6) • (2, 8, 2)) / ||u1||^2
u2 = (2, 8, 2) - (2/3, 1/3, -1) * 20 / 18
u2 = (2, 8, 2) - (20/9, 10/9, -10)
u2 = (-2/9, 62/9, 28/9)
e2 = u2 / ||u2|| = (-1/7, 31/35, 2/5)

u3 = (-6, 2, -12) - proj(u1, (-6, 2, -12)) - proj(u2, (-6, 2, -12))
u3 = (-6, 2, -12) - (2/3, 1/3, -1) * ((4, 2, -6) • (-6, 2, -12)) / ||u1||^2 - (-1/7, 31/35, 2/5) * ((-2/9, 62/9, 28/9) • (-6, 2, -12)) / ||u2||^2
u3 = (-6, 2, -12) - (2/3, 1/3, -1) * 60 / 18 - (-1/7, 31/35, 2/5) * 60 / 62
u3 = (-6, 2, -12) - (20, 10, -10) - (-60/62, 1860/2170, 120/217)
u3 = (-2, -8, -2)
e3 = u3 / ||u3|| = (-1/3, -4/3, -1/3)

2. Form the orthogonal matrix Q and the upper triangular matrix R:

Q = |  2/3  -1/7  -1/3 |
    |  1/3  31/35 -4/3 |
    | -1    2/5   -1/3 |

R = | ||u1||  (u1 • e2)  (u1 • e3) | = |  6   20/3  20  |
    |   0    ||u2||  (u2 • e3) |     |  0   62/3  60  |
    |   0      0    ||u3||   |     |  0    0    6   |

Now, we have A = QR, and we can solve the system Rx = Q^Tb:

Q^T = |  2/3   1/3  -1  |
      | -1/7  31/35  2/5 |
      | -1/3 -4/3  -1/3 |

Q^Tb = | (2/3)*10 + (1/3)*12 - 1*(-14) | = | 20 |
        | (-1/7)*10 + (31/35)*12 + (2/5)*(-14) | = | 20 |
        | (-1/3)*10 - (4/3)*12 - (1/3)*(-14) | = | -10 |

Now, we have the upper triangular system:

6x + 20/3y + 20z = 20
62/3y + 60z = 20
6z = -10

3. Solve the upper triangular system using back-substitution:

z = -10 / 6 = -5/3

y = (20 - 60*(-5/3)) / (62/3) = 100 / (62/3) = 150 / 62 = 75 / 31

x = (20 - 20/3*y - 20*z) / 6 = (20 - 20/3*(75/31) + 100/3) / 6 = 30 / 6 = 5

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = 5
y = 75/31
z = -5/3
